summary:
I am an Environmental Engineer with extensive experience in delivering proven results in technical design and analysis of different projects in water and wastewater treatment, environmental consultancy and sustainably. I hold BSc and MSc degrees in Environmental Engineering and technologies.

 I am a dynamic, motivated and well-grounded change agent with a passion for attaining the unachievable through analysis and collaboration. I consistently demonstrate a can-do attitude and embrace tough challenges with energy and enthusiasm.

Key Competencies:
- Environmental Consulting and Management
- Environmental impact assessment 
- Water and Wastewater Treatment
- Sustainability strategies
- Engineering Design and Analysis
- Project Management
- Strategic Planning and Implementation
- Process and Performance Optimization

Technologies:
- Computer-aided design (AQUASIM, ASPEN PLUS, ArcGis, BioWin, COMSOL , Minitab, WANDA, WAWTTAR)), Programming (MATLAB, PYTHON), MS Office (SharePoint, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Primavera, ISO 14001

Key achievements:
+ 1st prize in Sustainability category at ICAMES Engineering conference for wastewater treatment 
+ Upgraded a commercial hydraulic software through implementation of additional model
+ Auditing 16 decentralized water treatment plants
+ Energy saving and recovery through clean technologies from agricultural wastes
+ Innovative solutions and publications in the field of wastewater treatment
+ Innovative solutions and publications in the field of valorization of wastes and biofuels production
+ Contributed to environmental impact assessment for cement plants, water and wastewater treatment , and construction development projects

Please contact me by EMAIL to find out how I might contribute and add value to your organization.

projects.title: Microbial Desalination Fuel Cell for Efficient Wastewater Treatment, Saline Water desalination and Energy generation
projects.description:
The crisis of our dimensioning water resources is becoming extraordinarily severe. Saline water such as brackish water and sea water are considered as potential sources of water. Desalination is one of the most commonly used technique for water purification, but it is energy intensive. Therefore, there is a pressing and urgent need to develop new, less energy-intensive and efficient technologies for water desalination. The Microbial Desalination Cells (MDC) technology is a new sustainable approach that hold promising potential energy-efficacy for desalinating saline water. This is achieved through utilizing the organic matter and the microbial extracellular respiration activity in the waste water to produce energy to drive desalination. 
The exoelectrogenic bacteria present in the waste water is used to induce an electric potential gradient across the anode and cathode chambers, which desalinates water by moving charges through several continuous ion exchange membranes. In the current study we review and investigate the several factors that affect the amount of wastewater required to desalinate the saline water, for instance, the Microbial desalination cells structure, way of transport, and pH.

projects.title: New Alginate-Based Composites for Efficient Uptake of Fe(III) from Underground Water at the Bahariya Oasis
projects.description:
Underground Water at the Baharyia Oasis contain high concentrations of Iron. This negatively affects the Oasis’ people in different aspects of their lives. Metals

In the current study, new composite beads formulations consisting of Sodium alginate, Bentonite clay and Carrageenan of different ratios were prepared. The beads were lyophilized to maintain a high surface area. Then, iron metal ion uptake study was conducted on a standard solution of FeCl3.6H2O and the underground water from the Baharyia Oasis. The formulation with the most synergistic effect was determined, based on the UV-Vis data. Moreover, the beads’ Size, Swelling Extent were measured. Surface morphology was investigated using the Scanning Electron Microscope and the Stereo Microscope. Added to that, differential scanning calorimetry and FTIR and UV-Vis spectrophotometry were used to investigate the structure.

projects.title: A Comprehensive Study OF E.Coli ZK126
projects.description:
This comprehensive study was carried on Escherichia coli, strain ZK126. E.coli is mostly non-pathogenic, including the currently studied strain.This study aims to present a detailed description of the current strain, in order to enrich the microbiological literature, produce effective treatments and utilize the molecular contents for industrial application. Moreover, the current study focuses the following aspects of ZK126’s life, ranging from growth curves, growth inhibition, to the effect of environmental stress, identification methods and isolation of the associated bacteriophage. The results were further compared with results of other researchers .
This project was conducted and supervised by Professor Ayman El-Shibiny the Coordinator of the Microbiology course at Zewail City.
